content.question: A curve in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane is defined by the parametric equations <math alttext="x of t, equals, the cosine of, open parenthesis, 2 t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, the sine of, open parenthesis, 2 t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="t greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is equal to <math alttext="the square root of, open parenthesis, the derivative of x, with respect to t, close parenthesis, squared, plus open parenthesis, the derivative of y, with respect to t, close parenthesis, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math> ?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.1: (BC ONLY) Defining and Differentiating Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
